intro: Solenophora endlicheriana, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. Solenophora endlicheriana produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family.
